instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Help with personal 820.4924 board
threads.message:
Hi,

I am trying to fix a 820.4924 board for no other reason than to learn something new and save a macbook from the bin - i have never done anything like this in my life so it has been quite a curve !

The symptoms are that the mag safe orange light never goes green and the screen was showing a low battery picture but would never progress no matter how long left on charge.

So i removed the board from the machine - i only have a macbook air magsense 2 charger in the house which i understand should work to power up the board.

The board shows no signs of any damage so i followed the videos online and used boardview and the schematics to find that

1. PP3V3_S5_SMC = 3.42
2. SMC_BC_ACOK = 0.V

Which i think narrows the problem down to R5187 - again looks with no visible signs of damage

Am I correct in my thinking ? is there anything else i should be doing as regards tests here ?

Mark

threads.title: Help with personal 820.4924 board
threads.message:
Magsafe light will switch from orange to green ONLY when battery is fully charged 100%.
It stays orange even if no battery connected, as normal behaviour.

"SMC_BC_ACOK = 0.V"
You should not even get light on Magsafe.

Post exact voltage for PPBUS_G3H.
Also check diode mode to ground for SCL/SDA lines of battery bus; no battery, nor charger connected.
Less than 1% differenece allowed.
If not, post voltage for these lines too.

threads.title: Help with personal 820.4924 board
threads.message: A 45 watt charger will NOT work on this board whatsoever you need a 60/85 Watt OEM MagSafe 2 before we can continue. When you get one, see if the machine powers on without the battery attached

threads.title: Help with personal 820.4924 board
threads.message: Thanks - before progressing i have ordered the correct charger, better get the basics right !

threads.title: Help with personal 820.4924 board
threads.message:
45W charger will not start the board alone, but should charge the battery.
When battery gets some charge, it should start pressing power button; both charger and battery connected.

threads.title: Help with personal 820.4924 board
threads.message: Well - the 45W charger does not start the machine and as the battery was dead ( i didnt know this) it could not charge the battery. Therefore it looked like the board was faulty. As soon as i got the right charger the machine works but tells me that the battery is needing replaced. So for this board a 60w charger is needed before doing anything else. A lesson for me right there ! I have learned a lot though poking about so nothing lost :)

threads.title: Help with personal 820.4924 board
threads.message: Thank you for all your replies, should have asked sooner.
